tr.td:
Patient presents with chronic neck pain. Based on history, prior physical exam, and prior treatments, I recommend PA facet injection (bilateral C45/56), possible RF continue medication management Discussed treatment options with patient. Orders as indicated below.
Patient presents with bilateral knee pain. Discussed the following treatment options with patient: RT knee PA/RF, Left knee Gel One injection. Based on history, prior physical exam, and previous treatments, I do recommend a viscosupplement injection at this time for Left knee. Orders as indicated below.
Risk Level-mod based on MED
Results of most recent LCMS confirmation- collected today
Prescription drug monitoring program (PDMP) report was reviewed today and is
appropriate.
Left knee OA Failed injection and Pre ablation testing. will refer to ortho for eval

A prescription for opioids was prescribed today given the failure of more conservative treatment options. The risks, benefits, and alternatives were discussed in detail with the patient. Goals of improved activity and analgesia will continue to be monitored in subsequent encounters. There is no evidence of addiction or aberrancy to date.

tr.td: Onset: 2 years. location:AFdGQYQ spine, radiating to the bilateral upper extremities to the hand. Duration: waxing and waning. Context: MVA. Quality: throbbing, tightness, numbess, burning, sharp. Severity: current pain level: 0/10, worst pain level: 10/10. Alleviating Factors: stretching; DOES HER P.T. EXERCISE WHEN PAIN STARTS TO ACT UP. Aggravating Factors: ; CARRYING GROCERIES, BRUSHING HAIR. Timing: cannot identify. Previous Cervical Surgery: none. Previous Injections: cervical MBB/facet injections, cervical ESI, helped temporarily. Previous PT: completed PT

location:EzptEoHRN; RTK 2007. Quality: gnawing, stabbing, throbbing, constant. Severity: severe, pain level 9/10. Duration: 15+ years. Context: cannot identify; GRADUAL INCREASE IN PAIN OVER TIME. Alleviating Factors: heat, elevation, previous surgery. Aggravating Factors: weight bearing, cold weather, damp weather. Associated Symptoms: swelling, redness, warmth. Previous Surgery: ; RTK 2007. Previous Injections: ; Left knee PA 2022-09-10 "Still hurts" Right knee PA 2022-08-19, "Not bothering me"
Left knee worse, requires wheelchair over the last 8weeks.

Onset: 30 years, gradual onset; SERVER FOR 45 YEARS- WEAR & TEAR. location:EzptEoHRN paraspinal, midline spine, radiating down the right lower extremity to the foot. Context: started without cause. Quality: aching, burning, gnawing, stabbing, throbbing, deep, constant, not changing. Severity: moderate, current pain level: 7/10, average pain level: 7/10, worst pain level: 10/10. Alleviating Factors: heat. Aggravating Factors: standing, walking. Timing: cannot identify. Associated Symptoms: pain radiating down lower extremities. Previous Lumbar Surgery: none. Previous Injections: lumbar ESIs: minimal relief, lumbar medial branch nerve blocks: helped significantly. Previous physical therapy: completed all recommended PT visits. Daily Activities: Living independently., Unable to bathe/groom without assistance., Cannot complete household chores secondary to pain. Medications History: Muscle relaxants:, Neuropathics:, Opioid pain medications:
Constitutional: no significant weight gain, no significant weight loss
Musculoskeletal: arthralgias/joint pain, back pain, neck pain, difficulty walking
Allergy/Immunologic: no runny nose, no sinus pressure, no frequent sneezing

td.content: Cervical Spine, Lumbar Spine, General Joint and Spine

tr.td: Orientation: oriented to time, oriented to place, oriented to person. Mood and Affect: active and alert, normal mood, normal affect

Inspection: alignment normal. Soft Tissue Palpation on the Right: no tenderness of the paracervicals, no tenderness of the trapezius. Soft Tissue Palpation on the Left: no tenderness of the paracervicals, no tenderness of the trapezius. Bony Palpation: no tenderness of the occipital protuberance, tenderness of the transverse process right at C 5, tenderness of the transverse process left at C 5, tenderness of the C5 spinous process, tenderness of the C6 spinous process, tenderness of the C7 spinous process. Active Range of Motion: flexion normal, extension normal

Neck Strength (Intrinsics): extension 5/5, flexion 5/5, rotation 5/5, lateral flexion 5/5. C5 on the Right: abduction deltoid 5/5, external rotation infraspinatus 5/5, internal rotation subscapularis 5/5. C5 on the Left: abduction deltoid 5/5, external rotation infraspinatus 5/5, internal rotation subscapularis 5/5. C6 on the Right: flexion biceps 5/5. C6 on the Left: flexion biceps 5/5. C7 on the Right: extension triceps 5/5, flexion wrist 5/5. C7 on the Left: extension triceps 5/5, flexion wrist 5/5. C8 on the Right: flexion fingers 5/5. C8 on the Left: flexion fingers 5/5. T1 on the Right: abduction fingers 5/5. T1 on the Left: abduction fingers 5/5

Inspection: normal alignment. Bony Palpation of the Lumbar Spine: tenderness of the spinous process at L 4, tenderness of the transverse process on the right at L 4, tenderness of the transverse process on the left at L 4. Soft Tissue Palpation on the Right: tenderness of the supraspinous ligament, tenderness of the paraspinal region at L . Soft Tissue Palpation on the Left: tenderness of the supraspinous ligament, tenderness of the paraspinal region at L . Active Range of Motion: flexion ( deg.), extension ( deg.)

L1-2 Motor Strength on the Right: hip flexion iliopsoas 5/5. L1-2 Motor Strength on the Left: hip flexion iliopsoas 5/5. L2-L4 Motor Strength on the Right: knee extension quadriceps 5/5. L2-L4 Motor Strength on the Left: knee extension quadriceps 5/5. L5 Motor Strength on the Right: ankle dorsiflexion tibialis anterior 5/5, great toe extension extensor hallucis longus 5/5. L5 Motor Strength on the Left: ankle dorsiflexion tibialis anterior 5/5, great toe extension extensor hallucis longus 5/5. S1 Motor Strength on the Right: plantar flexion gastrocnemius 5/5. S1 Motor Strength on the Left: plantar flexion gastrocnemius 5/5
Right Shoulder: pain on palpation, reduced ROM. Left Shoulder: pain on palpation, reduced ROM
Right Knee: crepitus, reduced ROM. Left Knee: crepitus, reduced ROM
